template.description: This template shows how one might send a request for getting Tags from a Predix Time Series service instance
template.name: Get-Tags

inputPorts.name: predixToken
inputPorts.validationErrors: 'Port 'predixToken'' is invalid because Output connection for port 'predixToken' is not defined.

labels.label: This shows where the flow may have failed
TokenResponse is updated to contain only the token instead of the entire response

This shows where or how the invocation to Get Tags may have failed - - Follow the steps below to show more data on queued files 1. Right-click the queue --->a. A pop-up box covering most of the screen will appear once instructions -----> in step 2 have been followed 2. Select 'List Files' 3. Look for an Information icon on the left side of the pop-up box 4. Click the Information icon on the left side of the pop-up box --->a. Another pop-up box will appear 5. This box may have tabs that contain more information when clicked
The connections between GetTags and LogAttribute processors show that the ability to return the tags in either the body of the flowfile or as attributes in the flowfile exists
Token is placed in ORIGINAL flowfile, not response
The BODY of the response flowfile contains the tags
The ATTRIBUTE named theBody contains the tags sent in the response
Response containing Predix token is placed in an attribute with the name TokenResponse
